did.unittitle: Eardley-Wilmot correspondence

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Correspondence between Eardley-Wilmot and his friends and colleagues. Included are letters from Spencer Perceval and Henry Ellis about the Lansdowne Manuscripts, which Eardley-Wilmot was trying to place at the British Museum; from Mark Noble about Eardley-Wilmot's book on Bishop Hough; and from William Franklin about a Silas Deane letter that Eardley-Wilmot sent to Franklin. There are also many letters about Eardley-Wilmot's book on his father; about political patronage in British parliament; and about political developments in Great Britain after the French Revolution.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Eardley-Wilmot Correspondence is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Eardley-Wilmot Correspondence. Osborn Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

bioghist.head: JOHN EARDLEY-WILMOT (1750-1815)
bioghist.p: John Eardley-Wilmot was the second son of Lord Chief Justice Sir John Eardley-Wilmot. Born in 1750, he graduated from University College, Oxford in 1769, was chosen fellow of All Souls' College, and was called to the Inner Temple bar in 1773. From 1781 to 1804 he held a Mastership in Chancery. He served in Parliament from 1776 to 1796, first as M.P. for Tiverton and later for Coventry.

A Whig, in 1783 he was appointed head of the Commission for Inquiring into the Losses, Services and Claims of the American Loyalists, reporting on claims for compensation filed by Loyalists after the conclusion of the Revolutionary War. Eardley-Wilmot published his "Historical View of the Commission....." in 1815. He organized the Freemasons' Hall Committee for the relief of French refugees in 1790.

In addition to his professional and political activities, Eardley-Wilmot was a book collector and antiquarian whose materials were essential to John Raynor's edition of Glanville's Tractatus de Legibus (1780), and who furthered the British Museum's purchase of the Lansdowne manuscript collection in 1807. He was also an early supporter of King's College in Halifax, Nova Scotia.

Other publications by Eardley-Wilmot include Memoirs of the Life of the Right Hon. Sir John Eardley Wilmot, Knt., with some original letters (1802, 1811) and The Life of the Reverend John Hough, D.D..... (1813).

Eardley-Wilmot died at Bruce Castle on June 26, 1815. His only son, John, was created Sir John Eardley Eardley-Wilmot in 1822, appointed lieutenant-governor of Van Dieman's Land (Tasmania) in 1843, and died in Hobart in 1847.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The John Eardley-Wilmot Correspondence consists of three boxes of letters to and copies of letters by John Eardley-Wilmot, as well as a small number of personal papers and related items. The papers span the dates 1769-1912; the bulk of the material dates from between 1793 and 1810.
The letters are alphabetically arranged by author; retained draft copies of letters by John Eardley-Wilmot himself are arranged alphabetically by recipient under the entry for Eardley-Wilmot.

The collection reflects the variety of Eardley-Wilmot's intellectual and charitable interests. Letters from Christopher Anstey, John Anstey, Sir Joseph Banks, Benjamin Incledon, and Mark Noble discuss Oliver Cromwell's correspondence; Wilmot's writings are the subject of letters from Wynley Blair, Charles Butler, Robert Cadell, Daniel Coke, James Ross and others. Wilmot's early letters to his lifelong friend Henry Michell are in Latin and Greek, drawing upon their literary studies at Cambridge.

Eardley-Wilmot's participation in the political patronage systems of his day can be traced in the letters of Thomas Blomefield, Isaac Crakell, Baron Harrowby, Bishop Hurd, John Phillips, and WIlliam Pitt. A 1779 letter to Nathaniel Ryder discusses Eardley-Wilmot's views on the American Revolution, while a later letter to Benjamin West comments on the compensation claims made to the Crown by American Loyalists.

Eardley-Wilmot was the executor of the estate of William Petty, 1st Marquis of Lansdowne, and his role in the purchase by the British Museum of Lansdowne's manuscripts is documented in letters by Sir Francis Baring; Sir Henry Ellis; William Petty-Fitzmaurice, 3rd marquis of Lansdowne; Joseph Planta, and Spencer Perceval. His abiding interest in King's College, Nova Scotia, is seen in letters from Shute Barrington, Charles Inglis, and John Inglis; while his activities on behalf of French refugees are noted in letters by the 1st marquis of Buckingham, Edmund Burke, Jean François de la Marche, Samuel Parr, John Hampden Trevor, and an unidentified contributor to his fund who signed himself "Philo-Caritos".

Other correspondents of note include William Franklin; John Bowles, who in an 1807 letter expressed fear that dancing and music "naturally lead to licentiousness and debauchery" in the poor; and Warren Dawson, who was likewise concerned with "mirth and jollity among the lower classes." The letters of Martha Wilmot, Edward Wilmot, and John Henry Michell are largely personal in nature.
Box 3, folder 157 contains a small number of personal papers of John Eardley-Wilmot, including his call to Temple Bar. Folders 158-160 contain bibliographical and biographical information.
Descriptions of individual letters or correspondences can be found in the notes appended to many of the folder entries in the finding aid.

did.unittitle: Correspondence
"A" general
Adams, James. ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot
Ailesbury, Charles Brundenell-Bruce, 2d earl of, 1773-1856. 2 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot
Ailesbury, Thomas Brundenell-Bruce, 1st earl of, 1729-1814. 1 letter to John Eardley-Wilmot
Annesley, Francis. 2 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss the design and construction of Downing College, Cambridge.

did.unittitle: Anstey, Christopher, 1724-1805. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot, Bath

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns the authenticity of a letter written by Oliver Cromwell.

did.unittitle: Anstey, John, d. 1819. 2 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discuss an Oliver Cromwell letter.

did.unittitle: Aylesford, Heneage Finch, 4th earl of, 1751-1812. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns the memoirs of Sir John Eardley-Wilmot.

did.unittitle: "B" general
Banks, Sir Joseph, 1743-1820. 2 ALS (signatures removed) to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss an Oliver Cromwell letter.

did.unittitle: Barentin, Charles Louis François de Paule de, 1738-1819. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot
Baring, Sir Francis, 1740-1810. 7 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss business matters especially relating to the sale of manuscripts and an estate (probably the Lansdowne estate).

did.unittitle: Barrington, Shute, Bp. of Durham, 1734-1826. Letter to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter concerns patronage for Kings College Library, Nova Scotia.

did.unittitle: Birch, Wynley. ALS to W. Digby

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On the life of John Hough, Bp. of Worcester.

did.unittitle: Blakiston, Anne. 5 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters deal with an attempt to have Eardley-Wilmot secure a public position for Charles Blakiston, age 18, and failing this the letters deal with finding any means of respectable employment.

did.unittitle: Blomefield, Thomas, 1744-1822. 2 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discusses the expedition against Copenhagen. Blomefield commanded the artillery.

did.unittitle: Bowles, John. ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter concerns a fair and attempts to have it strictly regulated. Bowles is afraid that dancing and music are not harmless amusements for the lower classes, because of lack of education and different habits, "pleasures which are harmless and safe in one case, naturally lead to licentiousness and debauchery in the other."

did.unittitle: Browne, J. M. 2 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: About foreign and domestic problems in government.

did.unittitle: Buckingham, George Nugent-Temple- Grenville, 1st marquis of, 1753-1813. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter concerns Eardley-Wilmot's resignation as Commissioner for the French Emigrants and, as a reward, a position for one of his sons as "one of the Commissioners of Appeal in Excise Causes."

did.unittitle: Burke, Edmund, 1729-1797. 2 ALS (signatures removed) to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters deal with Wilmot's work with French refugees.

did.unittitle: Butler, Charles, 1750-1832. ALS and 1 letter to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On the memoirs of Sir John Eardley- Wilmot.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns the publication of the memoirs of Sir John Eardley-Wilmot.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Personal matters.

scopecontent.p: Letters discuss personal matters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns the memoirs of Sir John Eardley-Wilmot.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns a patronage position.

scopecontent.p: Thanks Wilmot for a present.

did.unittitle: Crakell, Isaac. 7 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters deal with a successful attempt by Crakell to obtain a patronage position for which Eardley-Wilmot's influence was necessary.

did.unittitle: "D" general
Dalrymple, Sir Hew Whitefoord, 1750-1830. 3 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot
Dartmouth, George Legge, 3d earl of, 1755-1810. Letter to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter thanks Wilmot for the present of a book.

did.unittitle: Dartmouth, William Legge, 2d earl, 1731-1801. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter of sympathy on the death of Sir John Eardley-Wilmot.

did.unittitle: Digby, William. 6 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters deal with Bishop John Hough.

did.unittitle: Disney, John, 1746-1816. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot
"E" general
Eardley-Wilmot, John, 1750-1815
ALS (copy) to George Nugent-Temple- Grenville, 1st marquis of Buckingham

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter expresses appreciation for the offer made to Wilmot's son concerning a position as Commissioner of Appeal in Excise Courses, and also asks that Wilmot be relieved, for reasons of health, from the Commission for the French Emigrants.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to Edmund Burke

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter is reply to Burke's letter to Wilmot of 1795 Feb 6. Letter discusses the morale of the country. "[T]he People in general do not seem apprized of the real state of the Country, namely that the Enemy is at the Gate."

did.unittitle: ALS to Eardley-Wilmot, Sir John Eardley

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerning travel, meetings, and his son.

did.unittitle: AL (copy) to John Scott, 1st earl of Eldon

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Congratulates Scott for resuming the great seal and presents him with a collection of John Hewlitt's sermons.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to Charles Long, Baron Farnborough

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Deals with the affairs of Mr. Marsh.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to William Gilpin

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Wilmot declines for reasons of time and health an invitation to help publish and write either a biography of William Gilpin or a collection of his correspondence. Indicates how he would organize such an undertaking.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to Nathaniel Ryder, 1st baron of Harrowby

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter expresses Wilmot's position on the Revolutionary War. At one point in the letter Wilmot refers to the "Americans" but this mistake is corrected by strikeovers and the insertion of the word "Colonies."

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to Francis Rawdon- Hastings, 1st marquis of Hastings
AL (copy) to Henry Petty- Fitzmaurice, 3d marquess of Lansdowne
ALS (copy) to Charles Manners-Sutton

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter recommends that John Inglis be chosen to replace his father Charles Inglis as Bishop of Nova Scotia.

did.unittitle: 15 ALS to Henry Michell

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 14 ALS in Latin and 1 in Greek to Michell, an accomplished Classical scholar, containing various quotations, epigrams, and discussions of Latin authors, as well as personal news.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to Brownlow North

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Tries to convince the Bishop to change the residence of Rev. Rivett, a "near Relation" to Wilmot.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to Spencer Perceval

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter deals with the Lansdowne Manuscript Collection and Wilmot's suggestion that it be sold to the government and deposited in the British Museum.

did.unittitle: 3 ALS (copies) to William Pitt

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Asks to be replaced as Master in Chancery and to be appointed Welch Judge; warns him of restlessness among lower classes. Asks for pension for Mr. Marsh. Discusses war in Europe and warns of invasion in England; worried about lack of unity in England, especially regarding the "disaffected within the Kingdom."

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to John Freeman-Mitford, 1st baron of Redesdale

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Seeks a different appointment for a relative of Wilmot's.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to Mr. Rose

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter discusses the affairs of a certain Mr. Marsh.

did.unittitle: ALS to Mrs. Statham

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerning personal relations and business matters.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to Brook Watson

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter deals with an attempt by Wilmot to obtain funds for the college in Windsor, Nova Scotia. Wilmot knows of a trust whose funds were to be used to establish a (Royal) College in New England.

did.unittitle: ALS (copy) to Benjamin West

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter gives an accounting of the claims of American Loyalists upon England for damages incurred during the American Revolution.

did.unittitle: AL (copy?) and poem to Robert R. Wilmot (cousin)
4 ALS to Matt Wren

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss Wilmot's election as fellow of All Souls College. The last two letters describe Wilmot's life in London and relate some of Parliament's actions.

did.unittitle: ALS to unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter contains Wilmot's suggestions for a proper education leading to a study of law.

did.unittitle: ALS to unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerning personal matters and business relations.

did.unittitle: ALS to unnamed recipient(s)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerning the catalogue of the Marquis of Lansdowne's manuscripts and the proposal to apply to Parliament for funds for their purchase by the British Museum.

did.unittitle: ALS to unnamed recipient

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerning the delivery of the Lansdowne manuscripts to the British Museum and Eardley-Wilmot's signature of the catalogue.

did.unittitle: Eardley-Wilmot, Sir John Eardley, 1783-1847. 2 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss both personal and public matters (Duke of Wellington's campaign).

did.unittitle: Ellis, Sir Henry, 1777-1869. ALS to Joseph Planta

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Concerns a collection of manuscripts.

did.unittitle: Erksine, Thomas Erksine, 1st baron, 1750-1823. ALS (signature cut) to John Eardley-Wilmot
"F" general
Fisher, A. ALS to William Digby

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter concerns information about Bishop Hough.

did.unittitle: Fox, Charles James, 1749-1806. ALS (signature cut) to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter informs Wilmot of a coming session of Parliament and warns Wilmot that "Business of the greatest Importance is intended to come on immediately."

did.unittitle: Franklin, William, 1731-1813. ALS and 1 letter to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter of 1806 deals with Silas Deane's advocacy of a reconciliation with England during the Revolution. Franklin dislikes the "violent Hot heads in Congress." Refers to Deane's secretary in Paris, presumably Edward Bancroft, a British double agent.

did.unittitle: "G" general
Gaskin, George, 1751-1829. 1 printed letter, signed, to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter informs Wilmot that he has been chosen to be a subscribing member in the Society for Promoting Christian Knowledge and will be a member as soon as he pays "a voluntary sum."

did.unittitle: Gilpin, William, 1724-1804. 15 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss family matters and on occasion deal with matters of state. One letter (1800 Oct 29) talks about Gilpin's son (John Bernard?) and his fortunes in America.

did.unittitle: Grantham, Thomas Philip de Grey, 3d baron, 1781-1859. ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot
Gregory, George, 1754-1808. 4 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters deal with personal matters including the memoirs of Sir John Eardley-Wilmot. One letter (1805 Feb) deals with Gregory's son and his plans to obtain legal training; same letter describes the living of West Ham, Essex, to which Gregory was presented in 1803.

did.unittitle: Gregory, John. ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter informs Wilmot of the death of George Gregory.

did.unittitle: "H" general
Hardwicke, Philip Yorke, 3d earl of, 1757-1834. ALS and 1 letter to John Eardley-Wilmot
Hargrave, Francis, 1741?-1821. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter concerns two books which were given to Hargrave by Wilmot.

did.unittitle: Harrowby, Nathaniel Ryder, 1st baron, 1735-1803. 5 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters deal with general parliamentary matters. 1777 Nov 29 contains the confession that Harrowby cannot support an unnamed proposal because it "would effectually disappoint every future Prospect of a Parliamentary Establishment for my Son."

did.unittitle: Hastings, Francis Rawdon-Hastings, 1st marquis of, 1754-1826. 5 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot
Heath, James, 1757-1834. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot
Hewlett, John, 1762-1844. 2 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First letter thanks Wilmot for his contributions towards securing a home for Hewlett; the second sharply criticizes "those fanatics who are called Methodists."

did.unittitle: Hurd, Richard, Bp. of Worcester, 1720-1808. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter deals with an attempt to have the Bishop give a patronage position to one of Wilmot's friends.

did.unittitle: "I" general
Incledon, Benjamin, 1730-1796. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter concerns an Oliver Cromwell letter.

did.unittitle: Inglis, Charles, Bp. of Nova Scotia, 1734-1816. 5 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters concern the King's College at Windsor, Nova Scotia, the need for it, its history and progress; his son was the first student. Letters discuss current events and people. Sends a copy of his protest, included.

did.unittitle: Inglis, John, Bp. of Nova Scotia, 1777-1850. 21 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters primarily deal with King's College of Nova Scotia, including administrative problems. Politics are also discussed and the threat of Bonaparte increases in the later letters. 1804 July 25 speaks of sectionalism in America. 1807 Nov 13 talks about the possibility of war between the U. S. and England. 1808 May 29 deals with American politics.

did.unittitle: "J" general
"K" general
"L" general
La Marche, Jean-François de, Bp. of St. Pol de Léon, 1729-1806. 6 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters deal with the conditions of French refugees.

did.unittitle: Lansdowne, Henry Petty-Fitzmaurice, 3d marquess of, 1780-1863. 5 ALS and 1 letter to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters deal with Wilmot's selection as Executor for Lansdowne's father's estate.

did.unittitle: Lansdowne, William Petty, 1st marquis of, 1737-1805. 12 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters deal mostly with personal matters. A few concern politics, such as the issue of French refugees (1792 Sep 23), where Petty shows his dislike of Edmund Burke.

did.unittitle: Lifford, Alicia (Oliver) Hewitt, viscountess, d. 1845. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter discusses personal matters.

did.unittitle: Lifford, James Hewitt, 1st viscount, 1709-1789. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discusses family matters.

did.unittitle: "M" general
Mackie, John, 1748-1831. 2 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot
Mansfield, Sir James, 1733-1821. ALS and 1 letter to John Eardley-Wilmot
Michell, I. C. 5 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters concern Wilmot's desire for information about John Hough, Bp. of Worcester.

did.unittitle: Michell, John Henry. 35 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss personal matters. Michell often would flatter Wilmot as best he could. In particular, 1792 Sep 20 describes Wilmot as aiding French refugees and blames the French Revolution on the "impiety of Voltaire." Pays tribute to the Bp. of Leon in 1807 Jun 16.

did.unittitle: "N" general
Nash, Treadway Russell, 1725-1811. 2 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot
Noble, Mark, 1754-1827. 2 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters concern Wilmot's study of Bishop Hough and Noble's study of Oliver Cromwell.

did.unittitle: North, Brownlow, Bp. of Winchester, 1741-1820. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot
"O" general
"P" general
Parr, Samuel, 1747-1825. 2 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss the French clergy and the French Revolution and give Parr's opinions on both matters.

did.unittitle: Parry, Charles Henry, 1779-1860. 2 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On Wilmot's health, symptoms and remedies.

did.unittitle: Perceval, Spencer, 1762-1812. Letter (copy) to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: About the Lansdowne Manuscript collection and its purchase by the British Museum.

did.unittitle: Phillips, John. ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thanks Wilmot for a copy of his books and seeks to obtain a political appointment.

did.unittitle: Philo-Charitos, pseud. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thanks Wilmot for his work to aid French exiled clergy and includes a donation.

did.unittitle: Pitcairn, David, 1749-1809. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On Wilmot's health.

did.unittitle: Pitt, William, 1759-1806. 3 ALS (signatures cut) to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: First letter requests Wilmot's attendance in Commons and the third deals with the proposed appointment by Wilmot to Public Office of a certain Mr. Marsh.

did.unittitle: Planta, Joseph, 1744-1827. 19 ALS and 1 letter to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters mostly deal with the sale of the Burleigh and Lansdowne Collections.

did.unittitle: Plumer, Thomas, 1753-1824. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thanks Wilmot for a copy of his book.

did.unittitle: Porteus, Beilby, Bp. of London, 1731-1808. 2 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot
Praed, William Mackworth. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thanks Wilmot for a copy of his book. Praed is the father of William Mackworth Praed, the poet.

did.unittitle: Price, John, 1734-1813. 4 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On several Oliver Cromwell letters.

did.unittitle: "R" general
Roberts, Thomas. ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discusses the deteriorating physical condition of Bruce Castle.

did.unittitle: Roberts, William, 1767-1849. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thanks Wilmot for a copy of his book.

did.unittitle: Romilly, Sir Samuel, 1757-1818. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: About Peter Mark Roget.

did.unittitle: Rooke, Sir Giles, 1743-1808. ALS and 1 AL to John Eardley-Wilmot
Rose, [George, 1744-1818]? ALS (signature cut) to John Eardley-Wilmot
Ross, James. 11 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss Bishop Hough of Worcester and deal mostly with engravings and sculpture of the Bishop. Ross was apparently an artist commissioned by Wilmot.

did.unittitle: Rough, William, d. 1838. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Discusses a private law case.

did.unittitle: Routh, Martin John, 1755-1854. 2 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: With copy of Eardley-Wilmot's reply.

did.unittitle: "S" general
Sargent, John, d. 1831. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thanks Wilmot for a copy of his father's memoirs.

did.unittitle: Sharp, Granville, 1735-1813. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thanks Wilmot for a copy of his book.

did.unittitle: Sperling, Henry P. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On the economic and political problems of an unnamed parish.

did.unittitle: Stevenson, Seth William, 1784-1853. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter discusses details of publishing a work by Wilmot.

did.unittitle: Stevenson, William, 1741-1821. 3 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters deal with political events pertaining mostly to local Parliamentary elections.

did.unittitle: Stover, John. 2 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter discusses John Hough, Bp. of Worcester, and includes a partial family tree.

did.unittitle: Strahan, George, 1744-1824? ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter discusses an Oliver Cromwell letter. Strahan describes Cromwell as having "rendered himself immortal, tho' it be only by Pre-eminence in Villany."

did.unittitle: Sutton, Thomas. ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter concerns the candidacy of a friend of Wilmot's for a Cadetship at the Royal Academy at Woolwich[?].

did.unittitle: "T" general
Trevor, John Hampden, 1749-1824. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter deals with the poor financial condition of a French refugee and Wilmot is asked for help.

did.unittitle: "W" general
Wakefield, Priscilla, 1751-1832. ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Thanks Wilmot for the use of his personal library.

did.unittitle: Warren, Dawson. ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter deals with a local problem concerning "mirth and jollity among the lower classes" and "licentious meetings of the Rich."

did.unittitle: Warren, John Borlase, 1753-1822. 4 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot and 1 ALS from Lady Warren

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The last letters speak of some of the logistical problems which the British Army faced.

did.unittitle: Wentworth, John to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: ALS expressing thanks for Eardley- Wilmot's gift to and interest in King's College in Halifax, Nova Scotia.

did.unittitle: Wilberforce, William, 1759-1833. ALS (signature removed) to John Eardley- Wilmot
Wilmot, Ann. ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot
Wilmot, Edward
7 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss personal matters. One letter (1784 Jun 4) proposes several forms of taxation which will not greatly bother the poor.

did.unittitle: 3 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On family financial matters.

did.unittitle: Wilmot, Emma. ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot
Wilmot, Lucy. 3 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot
Wilmot, Martha. 33 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters mostly discuss personal and financial matters. There are a few references to the Napoleonic Wars and to Russia's internal political affairs.

did.unittitle: Wilmot, Robert. 11 ALS to John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letters discuss personal matters and Sir John Eardley-Wilmot's memoirs.

did.unittitle: Windham, W[illiam, 1750-1810]? ALS (signature removed) to John Eardley- Wilmot
Wren, Matt. 4 ALS to John Eardley- Wilmot
"Y" general
Other Papers
Unidentified letter copies and letter fragments, some in French
Personal papers of John Eardley-Wilmot

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes certificate of his call to the Bar; manuscript (incomplete) of "A Letter to the Publick for the P. Advertiser"; printed copy of a commentary on a proposed monument for "Mr. Howard"; and bills and receipts.

did.unittitle: "Indices of letters"
Biographical and bibliographical information on John Eardley-Wilmot
"The Effects of the Preliminaries of the American Revolution on the Career of Sir John Eardley Wilmot", typescript photocopy
